muttest 0.1.0

Progress Reporter for Mutation Testing

MutationProgressReporter.Rd

Progress Reporter for Mutation Testing

Progress Reporter for Mutation Testing

Details

A reporter that displays a progress indicator for mutation tests. It provides real-time feedback on which mutations are being tested and whether they were killed by tests.

See also

Other reporters: MutationReporter

Super class

muttest::MutationReporter -> MutationProgressReporter

Public fields

frames

Spinner animation frames for dynamic display

dynamic

Whether dynamic output is supported in the current terminal

start_time

Time when testing started (for duration calculation)

min_time

Minimum test duration to display timing information

last_update

Time of the last progress update

update_interval

How often to update the spinner (in seconds)

frame_index

Current frame index in the spinner animation

mutations_by_file

List tracking mutation statistics by file

table_header_printed

Whether the table header has been printed

current_mutation_index

List tracking current mutation index by file

col_status_width

Width for status column

col_killed_width

Width for killed mutations column

col_survived_width

Width for survived mutations column

col_total_width

Width for total mutations column

col_file_width

Width for file name column

col_sep

Column separator string

Method new()

Initialize a new progress reporter

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$new(
  test_reporter = "silent",
  min_time = 1,
  update_interval = 0.1,
  file = stdout()
)

Arguments

test_reporter

Reporter to use for testthat::test_dir

min_time

Minimum time to show elapsed time (default: 1s)

update_interval

How often to update the display (default: 0.1s)

file

Output destination (default: stdout)

Method start_reporter()

Start reporter

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$start_reporter(plan = NULL, temp_dir = NULL)

Arguments

plan

The complete mutation plan

temp_dir

Path to the temporary directory for testing

Method start_file()

Start testing a file

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$start_file(file_path)

Arguments

file_path

Path to the file being mutated

Method start_mutator()

Start testing with a specific mutator

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$start_mutator(mutator)

Arguments

mutator

The mutator being applied

Method add_result()

Add a mutation test result

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$add_result(file_path, mutator, test_results, killed)

Arguments

file_path

Path to the file that was mutated

mutator

The mutator that was applied

test_results

Results from the test execution

killed

Whether the mutation was killed by tests

Method update()

Update status spinner (for long-running operations)

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$update(force = FALSE)

Arguments

force

Force update even if interval hasn't elapsed

Method end_file()

End testing current file

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$end_file()

Method cr()

Carriage return if dynamic, newline otherwise

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$cr()

Method end_reporter()

End reporter with detailed summary

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$end_reporter()

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

MutationProgressReporter$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
